page.title: 14AIRFIELD West Forres
page.content: This airfield is now owned and used privately by Sir Hector Laing, Chairman of United Biscuits,and many famous people have landed here when visiting his estate.These include Margaret Thatcher.The early history of the airfield is very interesting.During the war it was known as Forres Airfield and it had a very important role in the defence system.It was one of the main operational training units-19 O.T.U.Pilots,navigators etc. who had trained at separate units came together for the first time to fly Lancaster Bombers.They used very old Whitley Bombers for training and there were many accidents during training flights.Because of wartime security very few people realise the vital part played by Forres Airfield.
